description: Many serious injuries can be prevented if parents and other caregivers supervise children carefully and keep their environment safe.
title: Many serious injuries can be prevented if parents and other caregivers supervise children carefully and keep their environment safe.
content:
Young children, especially as they begin to move around on their own - and
particularly between 12 months and 4 years old - are at high risk of injuries
in and near the home. Almost all these injuries can be prevented. Prevention
requires supervising children carefully and keeping them away from dangers,
such as cooking fires, water sources, places where they can fall, roads, and
items that can poison, choke or hurt them.
